content:
Do this:

  1. install the addon, importexporttools NG on both PCs
  2. on pc!, highlight the folder, rightclick and select export mbox
  3. on pc2, highlight Local Folders, rightclick, and select import mbox and select the file created in step 1
  4. repeat for all desired folders.
creator: davidsk

content: Try this: click view>message body as>original HTML
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello David, 

                  Not really, as normally when you click on an email to open and read it also opens Firefox whether it is already loaded or not and displays the HTML page.

I notice others are complaining of similar problems. So hopefully those workers who do so much for us can fix it. I just went back and looked at old emails and there is no url html address as the first line just the name of the company that sent it, The html address was in the 2nd line. It could be that Thunderbird is looking at the wrong line and does not know it is an html page. Wirst possibility is that emails from another server is doing something that is wrong. de Barry

content: Maybe if you post a screenshot of what you see, someone may offer suggestions. I am unclear on your specific issue. Thank you.

content:
Upgrading to the Release Channel is optional. You'll still get security updates and bug fixes if you don't update. Your existing profiles will work with the Release channel. Consider the following to help you decide.

Release Channel:

- less stable

- newest features

- other improvements, e.g., graphical/functional

Note: some add-ons will not work until they are updated.

Extended Support Release Channel (ESR):

- more stable

- consistent behavior

- low maintenance

- fewer new features

See more details :

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel/

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-release/
creator: siffemoz

content: Try pressing F11 to get to full screen prior to setting the account.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thx much for your suggestion. Alas, pressing F11 does not get my TB to full screen: all it does is add a calender/events to the right of my messages of my old/existing email account (on the still reduced-size Thunderbird screen).

When I click on the square in the top-right corner of TB, it goes to full screen on my (less than two-year old) Dell laptop. When trying to add a (gmail) email account to my laptop TB that I've been using on my desktop for many years, I get stuck in the final step, a full screen labeled Google account.

It shows the new email address I'm trying to install, and then the words This will allow Mozilla Thunderbird Email to: - Read, compose send ... (etc.) - See, edit, download ... (etc.) - See, edit, permanently delete ... (etc.) followed by a line saying: By clicking Allow, you allow this app and Google to use this information.

That's all I can see on that screen: I don't see an 'Allow' button that I can click, I can't move the image or change its resolution in order to get an Allow button to appear. I'm stuck ... basically unable to use that (for me precious email account) on my laptop.

Any other suggestions would be appreciated.
creator: fdw2

content: Puzzling. Does the window pop up in thunderbird or the browser? Try pressing f11 when the popup shows.
creator: davidsk

content: Indeed puzzling. Pressing f11 when the popup shows does nothing. And whether the window pops up in thunderbird or the browser is something I can't say for sure: it could be either one. To get out of that full-screen pop-up, I press ESC and that gets me back to thunderbird.
creator: fdw2

content: Please clarify your account setup. Specifying to keep on server applies to POP, yet accessing from multiple devices requires IMAP. Have you logged in online to Yahoo to see if messages are there? If not, then they're only on your PC. Tell us more details. On your question, an IMAP account does keep PC and server in sync, not in Local Folders, but in the account's folders.
creator: davidsk
